cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north tonight then accelerate north-northeast, making landfall along the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday night, then sweep northeastward across the southeastern U.S. and Mid-Atlantic before moving offshore of New England early Friday

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City LA to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL (storm surge) and Morgan City LA to the MS/AL border (hurricane)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, then inland across the Southeast, Mid-Atlantic, and New England coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely winds 20–30 mph with higher gusts late Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston; surge threat confined to northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible as remnant low passes Friday, which could cause brief ponding on terminals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas/rip currents along the Massachusetts coast beginning late Thursday may disrupt pilotage and small-craft movements
